item.title: Report E-2025010205
item.description:
Report E-2025010205

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 56ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and the dock floor and estimated that seventy-five (75) gallons of material was released due to a forklift puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum of Hi-Temp 1200 causing it to knock over into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum of PBTCA damaging it. Before Clean Harbors’ arrival, Dayton Freight personnel had placed both damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks. Clean Harbors personnel deployed the neutralizer sodium bicarbonate and granular absorbents to the impacted area. They used a pH strip to test the paint inside the metal drum which resulted in a neutral result. All impacted absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to contractor demobilization. After departing off site, Clean Harbors personnel were asked to return to assist with the transfer of the contents of one (1) 85-gallon metal overpack drum to a one (1) 85-gallon poly drum due to the corrosive nature of the contained material. One (1) 85-gallon ploy drum was used to contain neutralizers and granular absorbents utilized during the transfer. Clean Harbors personnel staged one (1) 55-gallon poly drum, one (1) 85-gallon metal drum, and three (3) 85-gallon poly drums onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010197
item.description:
Report E-2025010197

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 14, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools, absorbents, soda ash, and a pH testing strip to remediate the impacted trailer. One (1) 55-gallon drum of cleanup debris and impacted material, and one (1) 55-gallon drum containing the damaged product were staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025010200
item.description:
Report E-2025010200

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCH experienced a UN3082 Rhonox Herbicide release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 165-gallons of product released due to a forklift puncture. The entire trailer floor, a 150’ x 30’ area of the concrete lot below, and 4 drains and 1 catch basin were impacted. All drains lead to the catch basin where the material was contained. The crew utilized a vac truck to remove the product from the catch basin and drains leading to it. Absorbents were deployed to the trailer and concrete lot and worked in. Once the drains were done, absorbent boom was placed in them to collect any residual material. The product remaining the damaged tote was pumped out and the damaged tote was cut up and containerized. Crew returned to site and inspected the drains and flushed and vacuumed them out again. Additional wastewater was generated to be offloaded into totes. Samples were collected to confirm that no residual material remains in the catch basin and samples were collected from the nearby retention pond as well as a precaution. All wastewater was offloaded into totes and all solid cleanup debris was containerized into 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report I-2025010030
item.description:
Report I-2025010030

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: MAWB 157-02144601 15pc, 1682KG ORD/MXP QR8112/12JAN25 HAWB S25CH100041 8pc 1068KG Upon screening of above MAWB, agents discovered an RPB label on inner contents of shipment 1 skid. Shipment was placed on hold. No declaration on MAWB for dangerous goods. Review of HAWB manifest revealed declaration of"Empty Buckets and Lids". QR inspected package which appeared and confirmed to be empty. Appears to be used bucket shipping to MXP, unknown if contains RPB residue. Shipment kept on hold UFN.

item.title: Report E-2025010166
item.description:
Report E-2025010166

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: HAMPSHIRE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately eight (8) ounces of material released from one (1) 275-gallon IBC poly tote due to a gash at the top of the tote. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
